column4: 12.10 updates screwed up the video playback... anybody had this issue? known fix?
I tried reinstalling the gstreamer plugins, vlc etc.
what player?  have you changed your VO output from XV to something else?  (common blue tint issue)
yeh I did the blue tint fix... applied patch for libvpau or something I remember sometime back...
fyi gstreamer probably defaults to XV
I had it set to OpenGL / XCB
changed to XV and still won't work
some videos play okay... like .mov etc...
;) i would have expected opengl TO work, and XV NOT to work ;)  sorry i don't have any further suggestions.  good luck.
Movie Player (default Player and UMPlayer) say "stream contains no data" etc.
that sounds like a possible codec issue.  try "mplayer".
yeah codec issue is the likeliest... but I've installed and updated all of em :(
gstream, the good, the bad and the ugly ;)
do you use mplayer with medibuntu's w32-something or w64-something?  that's a real test ;)
nop dude.. btw I use gnome UI & lxde...
I'm too slow and dumb to understand unity

i believe everyone should choose the DE/WM they want to work in.  then choose a gnu/linux distro that enables that selection (FYI ubuntu from mini (see "/msg ubottu mini" for details) can allow you to select NO DE/WM by default.  so just a "naked" ubuntu - install ONLY what you want from "sudo apt-get install foo" ;)
